lang::MemoryPool Class Reference
[Language support library]

#include <MemoryPool.h>

Inheritance diagram for lang::MemoryPool:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Handle based memory pool with compact support.

Note: Not thread safe.


Public Member Functions

int allocate (int bytes)
 Allocates a memory block from the pool.
int blocksAllocated () const
 Returns number of allocated blocks.
int bytesAllocated () const
 Returns number of allocated bytes (including gaps).
void compact ()
 Compacts used memory pool.
void dump () const
 Dump all contents of memory pool to debug output.

 Returns memory associated with handle.

 Creates pool with specified initial size and maximum size.

 Adds reference to memory block handle.
int size () const
 Returns size of the memory pool.

 Releases reference to memory block handle.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

lang::MemoryPool::MemoryPool (  int  size,
int  maxsize,
const char *  name
) 
 

Creates pool with specified initial size and maximum size.

Parameters:
size Initial size.
maxsize Maximum pool size. If 0 then the pool can grow without limits.
name Name of the pool. Used for debugging.

Member Function Documentation

int lang::MemoryPool::allocate (  int  bytes  ) 
 

Allocates a memory block from the pool.

Returned handle has reference count of 1.

Parameters:
bytes Number of bytes to allocate.
Returns:
Handle to the block.
Exceptions:
OutOfMemoryException 

int lang::MemoryPool::blocksAllocated (   )  const
 

Returns number of allocated blocks.

int lang::MemoryPool::bytesAllocated (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns number of allocated bytes (including gaps).

void lang::MemoryPool::compact (   ) 
 

Compacts used memory pool.

void lang::MemoryPool::dump (   )  const
 

Dump all contents of memory pool to debug output.

Warning: very large overhead.

char* lang::MemoryPool::get (  int  handle  )  [inline]
 

Returns memory associated with handle.

Does not alter memory block handle reference count.

void lang::MemoryPool::ref (  int  handle  )  [inline]
 

Adds reference to memory block handle.

Returns size of the memory pool.
